p: To evaluate the pathogenesis induced by the different recombinant viruses carrying mutations present in F-IAV, we infected mice with various virus doses of CAL, PB2 mut, PA mut or PB2/PA mut viruses or with DMEM as control. Survival ( Fig 7A) and body weight ( S9 Fig) were monitored daily for two weeks and the lethal dose 50 (LD50) for each virus was determined. CAL, PB2 mut, PA mut and PB2/PA mut viruses showed an LD50 of 1x10 5, >10 6, 3 x 10 3 and 3.5 x 10 4, respectively ( Fig 7B). These data confirmed that CAL virus is pathogenic in mice [ 1] and indicated that the PA D529N mutation greatly increased pathogenicity, suggesting a decisive effect of this polymerase change on disease outcome. PB2 mut, which accumulates high DVG levels, was greatly attenuated compared with the CAL virus. Reconstitution of the F-like polymerase-containing virus (PB2/PA mut) notably reduced DVGs accumulation ( Fig 5A) and led to higher pathogenicity compared with PB2 mut virus ( Fig 7A and 7B).
